0.$description: 0px - No border radius. Use for sharp corners and rectangular elements.

50.$description: 2px - Very subtle rounding. Use for small elements like badges, tags, or minimal design aesthetic.

100.$description: 4px - Small rounding. Use for compact elements and tight layouts.

150.$description: 6px - Standard component rounding (primary choice). Use for most UI components like buttons, inputs, dropdowns, and small cards.

200.$description: 8px - Standard component rounding (common choice). Use for most UI components like buttons, inputs, and interactive elements.

300.$description: 12px - Main surface rounding. Use for cards, panels, modals, and medium-sized containers.

400.$description: 16px - Large surface rounding. Use for main cards, large panels, dialog boxes, and prominent containers.

600.$description: 24px - Extra large rounding. Use for highly rounded surfaces and design emphasis.

800.$description: 32px - Very large rounding. Use for oversized elements and strong visual softness.

full.$description: Fully rounded (pill shape). Use for pills, circular avatars, and fully rounded buttons.
